User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; WOW64; rv:2.0b10pre) Gecko/20110122 Firefox/4.0b10pre
Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; WOW64; rv:2.0b10pre) Gecko/20110122 Firefox/4.0b10pre

Clicking and dragging inside a text box to clear text causes the horizontal scroll bar to move.

Reproducible: Always

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Make Minefield only fill the left half of your screen.
2. Search for something on Amazon.com.
3. Click and drag the mouse to highlight your entire search term.  Moving the mouse out of the text box area causes the Minefield horizontal scroll bar to move.
Actual Results:  
Horizontal scroll bar moves when the mouse pointer is out of the text box area and text is still highlighted.

Expected Results:  
Horizontal scroll bar should not move when active focus is inside a text box.  Expected results should be the same as in Internet Explorer (scroll bar doesn't move).

comments.text:
(In reply to comment #3)
> This also occurs with vertical text boxes.

What I mean by this is text boxes such as the "Additional Comments" section here that are multi-line.  If you drag the mouse out of the drawn window area, the vertical scroll bar will then move.  This doesn't occur with Internet Explorer.

comments.raw_text:
Don't worry, Mozilla, I am not trying to prevent people from using Firefox because it has bugs - that is not my intention for posting on YouTube.  The whole point of using YouTube is it has a much higher video attachment size limit than Bugzilla (which limits you to 2 MB) and a 25 second AVI file from CamStudio takes about 10 MB.  I am not switching to any other browser and will continue using Firefox, as it is my favorite browser and all browsers have bugs.

Once this bug is set to "RESOLVED FIXED", I will remove the video from YouTube, so people won't errantly think the bug still exists.
